title: Radik Yamlikhanov
text:
Radik Ramilyevich Yamlikhanov (; born 30 January 1968) is a Russian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and a former player. He is an assistant coach with <a href="PFC%20Sochi">PFC Sochi</a>.
Playing career.
As a player, he made his professional debut in the <a href="Soviet%20Second%20League">Soviet Second League</a> in 1988 for <a href="FC%20Iskra%20Smolensk">FC Iskra Smolensk</a>. He played 5 games and scored 1 goal in the <a href="UEFA%20Intertoto%20Cup%201996">UEFA Intertoto Cup 1996</a> for <a href="FC%20Uralmash%20Yekaterinburg">FC Uralmash Yekaterinburg</a>.
Personal life.
His son Robert Yamlikhanov is a professional football player.
